introduction: This video provides a step-by-step guide on how to use SQL or 'Sequel' for data reporting and analysis. It assumes no prior knowledge of SQL and uses all free tools. The video covers the basics of SQL, including querying data from databases, normalization, and using aggregate functions. The speaker emphasizes the importance of SQL in business and its ability to extract valuable insights from data.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to SQL
content: Explanation of SQL and its role in data reporting and analysis.
Discussion on the importance of SQL in businesses.
Overview of the video's objectives.
Introduction to the SQL Server Management Studio.

sections.title: Section 2: Installing SQL Server
content: Explanation of the SQL Server installation process.
Discussion on the different installation options.
Overview of the SQL Server Management Studio.
Explanation of the concept of normalization.

sections.title: Section 3: Querying Data
content: Explanation of SQL queries and their components.
Discussion on selecting data from tables.
Introduction to aggregate functions.
Example query to retrieve order data.

sections.title: Section 4: Filtering and Sorting Data
content: Explanation of filtering and sorting data in SQL.
Discussion on using WHERE and OR clauses.
Introduction to GROUP BY and HAVING clauses.
Example query to filter and sort order data.

sections.title: Section 5: Advanced SQL Concepts
content: Explanation of subqueries and joins in SQL.
Discussion on using UNION and INTERSECT operators.
Introduction to stored procedures and views.
Example query to retrieve data from multiple tables.
